description:
As a child, Monkey D. Luffy was inspired to become a pirate by listening to the tales of the buccaneer "Red-Haired" Shanks. But his life changed when Luffy accidentally ate the Gum-Gum Devil Fruit and gained the power to stretch like rubber...at the cost of never being able to swim again! Years later, still vowing to become the king of the pirates, Luffy sets out on his adventure...one guy alone in a rowboat, in search of the legendary "One Piece," said to be the greatest treasure in the world...

(Source: Viz Media)

tags.name: Pirates
tags.description: Prominently features sea-faring adventurers branded as criminals by the law.

tags.name: Travel
tags.description: Centers around character(s) moving between places a significant distance apart.

tags.name: Found Family
tags.description: Features a group of characters with no biological relations that are united in a group providing social support.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Ships
tags.description: Prominently features the use of sea-based transportation vessels.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Fugitive
tags.description: Prominently features a character evading capture by an individual or organization.

tags.name: Conspiracy
tags.description: Contains one or more factions controlling or attempting to control the world from the shadows.

tags.name: Crime
tags.description: Centers around unlawful activities punishable by the state or other authority.

tags.name: Military
tags.description: Centered around the life and activities of military personnel.

tags.name: Politics
tags.description: Centers around politics, politicians, or government activities.

tags.name: Terrorism
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a terrorist or terrorist organization.

tags.name: War
tags.description: Partly or completely set during wartime.

tags.name: Slapstick
tags.description: Prominently features comedy based on deliberately clumsy actions or embarrassing events.

tags.name: Time Skip
tags.description: Features a gap in time used to advance the story.

tags.name: Gods
tags.description: Prominently features a character of divine or religious nature.

tags.name: Primarily Adult Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters above a high school age.

tags.name: Post-Apocalyptic
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a world or civilization after a global disaster.

tags.name: Lost Civilization
tags.description: Featuring a civilization with few ruins or records that exist in present day knowledge.

tags.name: Slavery
tags.description: Prominently features slaves, slavery, or slave trade.

tags.name: Anachronism
tags.description: Prominently features elements that are out of place in the historical period the work takes place in, particularly modern elements in a historical setting.

tags.name: Cultivation
tags.description: Features characters using training, often martial arts-related, and other special methods to cultivate qi (a component of traditional Chinese philosophy, described as "life force") and gain strength or immortality.

tags.name: Large Breasts
tags.description: Features a character with larger-than-average breasts.

tags.name: Dystopian
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a society characterized by poverty, squalor or oppression.

tags.name: Religion
tags.description: Centers on the belief that humanity is related to supernatural, transcendental, and spiritual elements.

tags.name: Swordplay
tags.description: Prominently features the use of swords in combat.

tags.name: Mythology
tags.description: Prominently features mythological elements, especially those from religious or cultural tradition.

tags.name: Environmental
tags.description: Concern with the state of the natural world and how humans interact with it.

tags.name: Gangs
tags.description: Centers around gang organizations.

tags.name: Animals
tags.description: Prominently features animal characters in a leading role.

tags.name: Prison
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a prison.

tags.name: Espionage
tags.description: Prominently features characters infiltrating an organization in order to steal sensitive information.

tags.name: Meta
tags.description: Features fourth wall-breaking references to itself or genre tropes.

tags.name: Anti-Hero
tags.description: Features a protagonist who lacks conventional heroic attributes and may be considered a borderline villain.

tags.name: Skeleton
tags.description: Prominently features skeleton(s) as a character.

tags.name: Cyborg
tags.description: Prominently features a human character whose physiological functions are aided or enhanced by artificial means.

tags.name: Anthropomorphism
tags.description: Contains non-human character(s) that have attributes or characteristics of a human being.

tags.name: Primarily Male Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of male characters.

tags.name: Samurai
tags.description: Prominently features warriors of medieval Japanese nobility bound by a code of honor.

tags.name: Henshin
tags.description: Prominently features character or costume transformations which often grant special abilities.

tags.name: Adoption
tags.description: Features a character who has been adopted by someone who is neither of their biological parents.

tags.name: Assassins
tags.description: Centers around characters who murder people as a profession.

tags.name: Robots
tags.description: Prominently features humanoid machines.

tags.name: Food
tags.description: Centers around cooking or food appraisal.

tags.name: Guns
tags.description: Prominently features the use of guns in combat.

tags.name: Medicine
tags.description: Centered around the activities of people working in the field of medicine.

tags.name: Mermaid
tags.description: A mythological creature with the body of a human and the tail of a fish.

tags.name: Drugs
tags.description: Prominently features the usage of drugs such as opioids, stimulants, hallucinogens etc.

tags.name: Amnesia
tags.description: Prominently features a character(s) with memory loss.

tags.name: Revenge
tags.description: Prominently features a character who aims to exact punishment in a resentful or vindictive manner.

tags.name: Desert
tags.description: Prominently features a desert environment.

tags.name: Dragons
tags.description: Prominently features mythical reptiles which generally have wings and can breathe fire.

tags.name: Battle Royale
tags.description: Centers around a fierce group competition, often violent and with only one winner.

tags.name: Kemonomimi
tags.description: Prominently features humanoid characters with animal ears.

tags.name: Monster Girl
tags.description: Prominently features a female character who is part-monster.

tags.name: Oiran
tags.description: Prominently features a courtesan character of the Japanese Edo Period.

tags.name: Time Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features time-traveling or other time-warping phenomena.

tags.name: LGBTQ+ Themes
tags.description: Prominently features characters or themes associated with the LGBTQ+ community, such as sexuality or gender identity.

tags.name: Centaur
tags.description: Prominently features a character with a human upper body and the lower body of a horse.

tags.name: Ninja
tags.description: Prominently features Japanese warriors traditionally trained in espionage, sabotage and assasination.

tags.name: Transgender
tags.description: Features a character whose gender identity differs from the sex they were assigned at birth.

tags.name: Zombie
tags.description: Prominently features reanimated corpses which often prey on live humans and turn them into zombies.

tags.name: Memory Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features a character(s) who has had their memories altered.

tags.name: Trains
tags.description: Prominently features trains.

tags.name: Angels
tags.description: Prominently features spiritual beings usually represented with wings and halos and believed to be attendants of God.

tags.name: Female Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is female.

tags.name: Aliens
tags.description: Prominently features extraterrestrial lifeforms.

tags.name: Dinosaurs
tags.description: Prominently features Dinosaurs, prehistoric reptiles that went extinct millions of years ago.

tags.name: Clone
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is an artificial exact copy of another organism.

tags.name: Gender Bending
tags.description: Prominently features a character who dresses and behaves in a way characteristic of another gender, or has been transformed into a person of another gender.

tags.name: Bar
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a bar.

tags.name: Body Swapping
tags.description: Centers around individuals swapping bodies with one another.

tags.name: Shapeshifting
tags.description: Features character(s) who changes one's appearance or form.

tags.name: Primarily Child Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters below a high school age.

tags.name: Curses
tags.description: Features a character, object or area that has been cursed, usually by a malevolent supernatural force.

name.native: トニートニー・チョッパー

node.description:
__Favorite Animal:__ Big gentle dogs
__Favorite Mangaka:__ [Akira Toriyama](https://anilist.co/staff/96901/Akira-Toriyama)
__Favorite Music:__ '70s soul music
__Favorite Real-Life Pirate:__ Edward Teach (Blackbeard)
__Favorite Video Game:__ Puyo Puyo
__Trivia:__
- Oda is married to Chiaki Inaba, who had played Nami during Jump Festa One Piece stage performances.
- In a recent Japanese fan poll, Oda is currently ranked the 48th Most Popular Character in [One Piece](https://anilist.co/manga/30013/One-Piece/), despite the fact that he has never included himself in any issue of the manga (excluding SBS).
- He voiced the character ["Odacchi" (オダッチ)](https://anilist.co/character/12281/Eiichirou-Oda) in a [soccer-themed short](https://anilist.co/anime/2386/ONE-PIECE-Yume-no-Soccer-Ou/) that aired with the [3rd One Piece Movie](https://anilist.co/anime/461/One-Piece-Choppers-Kingdom-on-the-Island-of-Strange-Animals/). "Odacchi" is Oda's nickname, and he played soccer when he was younger.
- Oda is a fan of rapper Eminem, filmmaker Quentin Tarantino and [Tim Burton](https://anilist.co/staff/323667/Timothy-Walter-Burton).
- Oda's 3 favorite movies are Seven Samurai, The Nightmare Before Christmas, and Young Guns.
- According to Oda in an interview for US Shonen Jump, his favorite villain in One Piece is [Buggy the Clown](https://anilist.co/character/725/Buggy) (he joked that he literally threw him together).

Former assistant of the mangaka [Eiichirou Oda](https://anilist.co/staff/96881/Eiichirou-Oda), [Kouhei Horikoshi](https://anilist.co/staff/104834/Kouhei-Horikoshi), [Kouji Ooishi](https://anilist.co/staff/112651/Kouji-Ooishi), [Yoshikazu Amami](https://anilist.co/staff/137228/Yoshikazu-Amami), and [Kazue Katou](https://anilist.co/staff/103052/Kazue-Kato).

He is the son of the animator and animation director [Hiroki Shibata](https://anilist.co/staff/124452/Hiroki-Shibata). His younger sister [Hikari Shibata](https://anilist.co/staff/127324/Hikari-Shibata) is also a mangaka. He is married to the illustrator [OKADA](https://twitter.com/hoooojicha).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/tokiwablue21)

**Birthplace:** Oslo, Norway

Terje Nordberg is a Norwegian comics artist, writer, translator and magazine editor.

Mark McMurray is a seasoned freelance artist with extensive experience in digital lettering and art retouching for notable manga publications at [VIZ Media](https://anilist.co/studio/119/Viz-Media) since February 2004.

Lilian Toshimi Mitsunaga, or Miriam Tomi, is a brazilian letterer who started her career at Editora Abril in 1980, in the creation of letters for the publisher's comic books. Nowadays, she works through her studio Lua Azul, which works for both Abril and Conrad, Compania das Letras, etc.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/vsatone/) | [Official Website](http://visforvacant.com/) | [Tumblr](https://vsatone.tumblr.com/) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/vsatone/) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/vsatone/)

Graduated from the School of Visual Arts in 2001 with a BFA in Illustration and Cartooning. She is currently the letterer for One Piece, Kimi ni Todoke: From Me to You, and 07-Ghost. She was formerly a graphic designer for CPM Press and Be Beautiful Manga. Vanessa has self-published four graphic novels and many mini comics. She lives in Brooklyn, with some people and some cats. Vanessa enjoys fruity, brightly colored alcoholic beverages and wearing obnoxious, brightly colored sunglasses.
He is touch-up artist and letterer.
He is the Editor in Chief of Weekly Shonen Jump.
